discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct answer.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/enhanced-interior-gateway-routing-protocol-eigrp/82110-eigrp-authentication.html

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Two Cisco Nexus Series Switches use EIGRP between their Eth1/1 interfaces. The switches are configured to support EIGRP authentication. Which set of CLI commands must be used to establish EIGRP neighborship?

discussion.content:
switch# configure terminal
switch(config)# feature tacacs+
switch(config)# tacacs-server key 7 "ToIkLhPpG"
switch(config)# tacacs-server host 10.10.2.2 key 7 "ShMoMhTl"
switch(config)# aaa group server tacacs+ TacServer
switch(config-tacacs+)# server 10.10.2.2
switch(config-tacacs+)# use-vrf management

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

All logins to a Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switch must pass through the TACACS+ server at IP address 192.168.10.10. The configuration must meet these requirements:

• The TACACS+ server must be used for SSH and Telnet.
• The TACACS+ server key must be Cisco123!.
• Management VRF must be used for connectivity.
• The deployment must fail back to local credentials if the TACACS+ server fails to respond within 30 seconds.

Drag and drop the code snippets from the right onto the blanks in the code on the left to complete the configuration. Not all code snippets are used.

//IMG//

choices.B: aaa authentication login console group local
choices.A: aaa authentication login default fallback error local
choices.D: aaa authentication login default group ISE local

questions.question_text:
The Cisco TACACS+ on a Cisco Nexus Series Switch must authenticate any user attempting to access the device and fail over to the local account if the TACACS+ sever becomes unavailable.
Which command accomplishes these goals?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
As per the link below, fallback to local authentication is enabled by default.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/5_x/nx-os/security/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide__Release_5-x/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide__Release_5-x_chapter_0100.html

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D

It cannot be C.
command aaa authentication login default local 
Sets the login authentication to use the local username database. The default keyword applies the local user database authentication to all ports

comments.content: posible but lacking info from the question, like ISE is the name of the group tacacs

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
look at 475 for confirmation

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C
Actually is D, you can confirm this by looking at Question #475

Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer :

C

aaa authentication login default {group group-list [none] | local | none}

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/6-x/security/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide_chapter_0111.html

"fallback" command for disable local authentication

questions.question_text:
A QoS policy on Cisco UCS must meet these requirements:
• No-drop class must be configured.
• Jumbo frames must be enabled without fragmentation.

Which configuration must be implemented to mast these conditions?

discussion.content:
C:
System class: Fibre Channel
A system class that sets the quality of service for the lane reserved for Fibre Channel over Ethernet traffic.
Some properties of this system class are preset and cannot be modified. For example, this class has a no-drop policy that ensures it never drops data packets. You cannot disable this system class.

https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/cli/config/guide/1.4.1/CLI_Config_Guide_1_4_1_chapter17.html#task_8355257724788063901

Selected Answer: C
C, no drop can be assigned to any class

Selected Answer: D
no drop mean platinum that is the only one to guarantee the no drop

choices.B: Create a Flow Control Policy and specify an MTU value of 9000 bytes.
choices.D: Configure Platinum system class and specify an MTU value of 9100 bytes.
choices.A: Configure slow-drain timers and specify an MTU value of 9100 bytes.
choices.C: Create a QoS system class and specify an MTU value of 9216 bytes.

questions.question_text:
An engineer must create a new Cisco UCS user account to perform these actions:
• Modify systems logs, faults, and power management settings.
• View access to all other configuration in the UCS domain.

Which two roles must be assigned to the user to permit these actions? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Answer is C and D.
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/cli/config/guide/1.4.1/CLI_Config_Guide_1_4_1_chapter9.html#concept_842995A3D6954CDDBC07EAB7EE6E74B5
